title: Print/book Illustration, "Fontaine des Innocents (Fountain of the Innocents), Paris:  View Showing two Facades Simultaneously, from Vues des Belles maisons de France (1650)", 1650
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Two views of the Fontaine des Innocents showing the fountain  facade facing on to the Rue St. Denis (left) and that facing on to the Rue aux Fers (right).  Left facade has bay while right facade has two bays.  Wach bay has a frieze, central rounded arch flanked by two lpilasters and reliefs of nymphs. Below dado is large base from which two faucets provide water.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print/book Illustration, "Fontaine des Innocents (Fountain of the Innocents), Paris:  View Showing two Facades Simultaneously, from Vues des Belles maisons de France (1650)", 1650.
1650. etching. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-559.
